summary.executive_summary: The IT Consulting industry has experienced steady growth driven by increasing corporate profit, private investment in computers and software, and the adoption of new technologies like cloud computing and data analytics. Major players have pursued mergers and acquisitions to gain market share and expand service offerings. The industry remains fragmented due to low barriers to entry and a wide range of niche services offered. Future growth is expected from continued technological innovation, improving economic conditions, and rising demand for online platforms and mobile applications.
summary.industry_definition: The IT Consulting industry includes firms that provide the following services to client companies: writing, testing and supporting custom software; planning and designing integrated hardware, software and communication infrastructure; and on-site management of computer systems and data processing facilities. This industry excludes packaged software publishers and off-site data processing and hosting services.
key_trends: The industry has experienced an uptick in demand over the past five years as the economy grew steadily.
Major players in the industry have switched their focus toward cloud-based computing and data analytics.
Major players have looked to gain the upper hand in the industry as it adapts to cloud-based computing by merging or acquiring competitors.
The rapidly changing nature of the industry enables new entrants who specialize in new kinds of technology to enter the industry.
The increased use of mobile devices to access the internet will boost industry revenue.
Faster networks allow users to access data-heavy content, like streaming videos through their mobile devices, resulting in greater demand for application and system design.

tier_1_suppliers: Computer & Packaged Software Wholesaling in the US
Internet Service Providers in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Computer Peripheral Manufacturing in the US
Communication Equipment Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Finance and Insurance in the US
Healthcare and Social Assistance in the US

summary.competitive_landscape: The industry is fragmented with the top 4 players accounting for just over 5% of revenue. Rapid technological changes encourage new entrants catering to niche markets.
summary.costs_and_operations: Key costs are wages (43% of revenue), miscellaneous expenses like travel (38.9%), and purchases of hardware/software (7.1%). The industry has low capital requirements.
